title: NASA delays astrophysics mission call for proposals amid budget uncertainties
summary:
NASA is delaying the next competition for an astrophysics mission by a year, the latest sign of the fiscal pressures from an upcoming budget proposal.
The post NASA delays astrophysics mission call for proposals amid budget uncertainties appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Why space needs nuclear now
summary:

title: May’s Night Sky Notes: How Do We Find Exoplanets?
summary: Astronomers have been trying to discover evidence that worlds exist around stars other than our Sun since the 19th century. By the mid-1990s, technology finally caught up with the desire for discovery and led to the first discovery of a planet orbiting another sun-like star, Pegasi 51b. title: The Universe’s Brightest Lights Have Some Dark Origins
summary: Did you know some of the brightest sources of light in the sky come from the regions around black holes in the centers of galaxies? It sounds a little contradictory, but it’s true!
